# Contract Investigator Source List (525-22-RQ-001)

## Overview

The Military Police Complaints Commission of Canada (MPCC) seeks Requests for Qualification (RQ) from qualified suppliers to become pre-qualified to be on a Source list for Investigation Services. The MPCC welcomes diverse suppliers, including Indigenous businesses, and invites all interested parties to submit their qualifications.

## Submission Requirements

Bidders are invited to submit responses in the form of a detailed proposal, outlining how their investigator resources meet the technical evaluation criteria outlined in Annex B. The responses will be formally evaluated and used as reference against future traditional competitive requirements.

The MPCC will consider responses received before the closing date and time of November 15, 2022, at 14:00 EST (Ottawa, Ontario time). Late submissions will not be considered for the Source list.

## Security Requirements

The Security Requirements for this project are identified in Annex E to this tender.

## Process

The pre-qualification process consists of two stages:

1. **Pre-qualification**: Suppliers will submit responses, including an updated CV and completed Annex B, to demonstrate how their investigator resources meet the technical evaluation criteria. Qualified investigators will be invited to attend a validation interview and will be registered on the Source List if successful.
2. **Contract Award**: Suppliers with qualified investigator resources will be invited to bid on individual contracts for services below the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA) threshold. The CKFTA threshold for 2022-2023 is $100,000 and is subject to periodic adjustments.

## Evaluation Criteria

The MPCC will evaluate responses from invited suppliers based on the technical evaluation criteria outlined in Annex B.

## Inquiries and Submission

Suppliers with questions may direct their inquiries to Julianne Dunbar at commission@mpcc-cppm.gc.ca or 1-800-632-0566 (toll-free). Each respondent is responsible for ensuring their response is delivered on time, in the right format, and to the correct location.

## Contact Information

* Name: Julianne Dunbar
* Email: commission@mpcc-cppm.gc.ca
* Phone: 1-800-632-0566 (toll-free)
* Address: 270 Albert Street, 10th Floor, Ottawa, Ontario K1P 5G8, Canada
